docs.snippet: The city’s history helps explain the long-simmering anger that boiled over this week with the death of Freddie Gray, who suffered a severe spinal cord injury in police custody....
docs.lead_paragraph: The city’s history helps explain the long-simmering anger that boiled over this week with the death of Freddie Gray, who suffered a severe spinal cord injury in police custody.
docs.abstract: Death of Freddie Gray while in police custody is latest incident in long history of tensions between Baltimore Police Department and city residents, fueling anger that exploded in protests; data shows that Baltimore police officers killed 127 people over two decades ending in 2012, significantly more than other cities of similar size.

byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen contributed reporting from New York.

docs.snippet: After years of Israeli objections, armed Palestinian police in dark blue uniforms have taken up positions in this lawless West Bank suburb of Jerusalem, highlighting the shared interests of Israel and the Palestinian self-rule government on day-to...
docs.lead_paragraph: After years of Israeli objections, armed Palestinian police in dark blue uniforms have taken up positions in this lawless West Bank suburb of Jerusalem, highlighting the shared interests of Israel and the Palestinian self-rule government on day-to-day issues even when political tensions run high.

headline.main: Palestinian Police Now in Jerusalem Suburbs After Israel Ban
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Police Now in Jerusalem Suburbs After Israel Ban

docs.snippet: Barry Goldwater was asked whether he was pleased by the heavy bombing raids. “No, I’m not,” he replied, affably. “They’re not bombing enough.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Barry Goldwater was asked whether he was pleased by the heavy bombing raids. “No, I’m not,” he replied, affably. “They’re not bombing enough.”

headline.main: Will the Vietnam War Ever Go Away?

docs.snippet: Europe is struggling with how to save lives on the sea, prosecute human smugglers and deal with the causes of the migrant surge closer to their source....
docs.lead_paragraph: Europe is struggling with how to save lives on the sea, prosecute human smugglers and deal with the causes of the migrant surge closer to their source.
docs.abstract: European leaders will triple funding for search and rescue missions of smuggled migrant workers in Mediterranean Sea; still, efforts will not make up for cancellation of Italian Naval program Mare Nostrum, which saved thousands of lives while successfully prosecuting smugglers; some criticize response to crisis as insufficient and shortsighted.

headline.main: Migration Crisis Puts Europe’s Policy Missteps Into Focus, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Migration Crisis Puts Europe’s Policy Missteps Into Focus, Experts Say

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Catania.
